question.text: Which of the following is correct for the microbe producing a molecule the same as the first stable product of Kreb's cycle?

options.text: They belong to the same group in which bread mould is placed.
They belong to the same group in which the microbe responsible for producing the first antibiotic is placed.
They belong to the same group in which the microbe responsible for biological control of the plant pathogens is placed.
They belong to the same group in which the microbe responsible for causing smut and rust is placed.

solution.text: The first stable product of Kreb's cycle is citric acid or citrate. Aspergillus niger belonging to Ascomycetes is the microbe used to produce citric acid on a large scale. The group Acsomycetes include organisms like Yeast (produces alcohol), Penicillium (the source of first antibiotic penicillin), Claviceps and Neurospora (both used in genetic engineering).
